result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley A Schmidt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:25 am 
INCLUDES 16CF528, 15CF925, 15CF319, AND 16CF124. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 16CF528: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF925: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF319: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/PTAC)>>AMEND to Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC pursuant to 961.41(3g)(e). 
                   : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine)>>D&RI. 
                   : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF124: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CF528: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF319: Amended Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF124: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with any recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/child care/combination of the 3 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit at this time - notes parties can submit written stipulation re: credit at later date. 
COURT finds the def eligible to petition for expungement no sooner than def's 25th birthday if probation is completed successfully. 

Adj: 9:47 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 5, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:22 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF528, 16CF124, 15CF925, AND 15CF319. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 16CF528. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. R/J. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set dates. 

Adj: 1:25 pm
Review hearing on August 30, 2016 at 01:05 pm.
Status conference on July 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Clerk Cheree

State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Abernethy-Mays
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed this afternoon mirroring complaint.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates to be set at conclusion of this hearing.
Bond:  Continued

Adj: 2:04pm

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting within 1 business day.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
